comments.body: Yeah and pillar and chiselled blocks too
Totally agree! + Brick Stairs, Chiseled, and Pillars
Polished/Brick/Chiseled versions of Calcite, Tuff, and Dripstone would be great too!
Yes I was about to post this!:D Everyone vote for this.

Yeah and pillars
This would be amazing
Tuff bircks would be great!
Yes totally agree; like in the Create Mod
Yes. That would be a great idea. Why does blackstone have it but these cannot? That's so random.
Голосуем за это
More consistent stone all around, please!!!
That would be great!
it would be good for cities

This is a good way to add detail and more blocks in our colour palets for builds and it's really a shame that there isn't any of those type of blocks for more stone-like blocks like there is for quartz for example.

There could be all those types of blocks :

  • Bricks
  • Brick slab
  • Brick stairs
  • Chiseled block
  • Polished block
  • Polished stairs
  • Polished slabs
  • Pillars
  • Walls

And those for most type of stone like Granite, Dirorite, Tuff and Calcite. It would be, as I said before, a great way to add more details, and do some more specific builds to tell specific stories just by looking at the build, you could maybe have some cracked variants too and I think it would be really awesome.
I also like bricks
I want that since 1.12
maybe it's even not so late to use them in trail ruins structure
yea that would be PERFECT! For Minecraft builders AND! Backrooms builds. like I need something else instead of stone bricks for the Walls for Level-1.
granite diorite and andesite are pointless if this doesn't happen

Yeah it should be a great idea

They can add:

Bricks

Brick slab

Brick stairs

Chiseled block

Polished block

Polished stairs

Polished slabs

Pillars

Cracked versions

Infested 

And also they should add smooth stone stairs
I love to use diorite for biulds and think having more types like the stone bricks and quartz pillars.

I still don't get why they only have polished versions...
Abd tuff doesn't any at all
Only for the polished versions.
also the other variants, with moss or cracked
But this is nonsense. Wooden ladders must be able to hang down and be built up a few blocks. And the sticks are just made from bamboo.

To avoid making them just the straight up preferable option to normal ladders, they should be rope ladders instead of pure bamboo ladders, meaning the corner items would have to be either string or vines, making them less accessible than the standard ladders in exchange for being better.
So basically like a rope ladder in real life, but a little different.
There are a few plants in the game that could do the same purpose
To make sure they’re not the exact same as ladders and give more of a reason to use them, they should be one pixel thick, rather than looking flat/invisible from the side.

I think this should just be a change to normal ladders... along with the addition of ladders for every wood type, perhaps crafted with six sticks and one plant in the middle (cause I think adding a stick for each wood type would be a little excessive, personally...).

As much as I like the idea of more ladder variants and textures, this just calls into question the point of having this included but then again they made a reskinned boat for the sake of it with a entirely new model yet we don't have different ladder textures so take that how you will; it'd still be nice.
make it rope instead, like bamboo and 2 string together could make a rope and it would have a similar design to scaffolding, but obviously as a rope shape instead
О крутая идея!

It's a great idea.
I think that we could, by a right click on a bamboo ladder, place more ladders UNDER the first ladder, as if there's no block (maybe on 5 blocks max).
Why not make them quicker to climb ?
And you could say that nobody is gonna use normal ladders, but bamboo is rarer add wood.
Hanging sounds ok.  As long as the texture for this was 3d and couldnt go onto other blocks.

I think it should work for both ladder types, but you'll be able to go through bamboo variant, like through vines, yet you can't do it through normal ladders. May be bamboo variant could also use strings in craft (6 strings and 1 bamboo in the middle, or 4 strings and 3 bamboo)?
Also these ladders should work almost similar to scaffoldings, but vertical.

Placing.
Normal ladders can be placed on top side of block, and can be upscaled like scaffolding with right clicking on bottom ladder.
Ladder have life time 2s. If you'll make ladder higher, lifetime of all these ladders will update to 2s again.
If the placed ladder will touch a block (will be placed on the side of a block), all lower ladders won't break anymore!

Placing of bamboo ladder.
Bamboo ladder can't be placed on the top side of a block like normal one, because it's made with strings! Bamboo ladders can only hang down like vines.
You can place it on the side of a block, and if you'll right click on it while holding bamboo ladder, you'll place it lower, like scaffoldings, but vise versa.

Breaking of supporting blocks will break whole ladder, like when you break solid block under the lowest scaffolding block.
Elle devrait faite de vignes et de bambou et faire l'épaisseur d'une trape ,sur la textue on verait vraiment des bambou et des vignes (bambou en 3d)
I agree. Maybe it would be in the feedback post 1.20 Jungle Villages?
Jeez, you are really getting your point across.

Why not add a inventory screen like Horses, Camels, and Llamas?
Yeah the Camels, Pigs, and Horses don't have inventories like Donkeys, Mules, or Llamas but they do still allow you to take the saddle out and the Pig and Striders need that function to get the Saddle back without having to kill the animal.

Striders are the only source of string in the nether. If your doing nether survival from the start, you're gonna need to.
But I agree there should definitely be an inventory screen for when we don't need to.
This should be changed honestly.
Yes. Exactly. Even if it was just shift-clicking while dismounted
The amount of striders I have killed... This feature is NEEDED
I think that Microsoft prohibited "SCREAMING" so be careful.

I agree I wish I could use only 1 saddle in early game for the cutie little saddle guys without inventories. like we can do it with horses, maybe also make it like that if shift right click doesn't feel right? IDK.
I should be in the game, so u dont have to murder your pet pig(/strider)
Great idea!
Why is this not in the game????Mojang please fix this!!
Why not use shears to remove saddles, just like for wolves?
Moolips (pink moobloom variants from Minecraft Earth) should spawn there.

Hello Minecraft Team, My name is ChrisWoltan, I would like to request a change in the texture and opening/closing mechanics of the door that was announced for the Cherry Blossom Biome variation. Could you make the texture resemble traditional oriental doors, called Shōji? Also, could you make the door's opening mechanics slide, like a sliding door?

Thank you very much for your attention, Minecraft team!

Please please *please* make the new cherry blossom wooden planks a unique colour on map items. We desperately need a second pink colour in the mapart palette that can be picked for skin and flesh tones. Pink is the most underrepresented colour in the map palette and this would be the absolute perfect opportunity to add a new shade and new flexibility to mapartists.

Hiya! I love this new biome and I think a new mob would really help set it apart! For example I would love to see something like the Hedgehog from Minecraft Dungeons or Butterflies to really add to the cute and cuddly personality of the Cherry grove!
I would like to suggest White Cherry Blossom variants of the pink trees. It would add amazing diversity to the Cherry Grove biome.

There should be a less common chance find or grow a Cherry Blossom Tree variant of the Trees, a.k.a. a "Cherry Weeping Willow".

However, rather than generate green vines to give the "weeping willow look"; The Vines that generate on Cherry Blossom trees should instead be of a similar color scheme of the respective Cherry Blossom tree it has generated on, to complete the illusion.

Definetly need some more foliage, rn its just looks like a regular plain/mountain biome with cherry trees in it.Something like bamboo or tall flowers in there would make it prettier i think.Maybe change particle too? like falling leaves particle

Perhaps, make only neural & peacefully mobs spawn in this Biome, or at the very least on the surface of it; with the exception of spiders, phantoms, and endermen at night. Of course other Hostile Mobs should still be able to spawn in the surrounding Biome(s), and thus travel into the Cherry Blossom Biome.

The new cherry wood, planks, and variants look great. The Cherry Sapling is beautiful and lovely. The one comment I have is on the leaves. On a cherry tree they feel a bit flat, and they lack the abundance of transparency that most leaves have. They also do not seem to change colors between biomes like most leaves, but I think that's a good thing. Adding transparency on the leaves would improve how they look, or something like the pink petals on the ground, but for the leaves

The Cherry Blossom forest feels really empty right now (I know it's in its early stages). It could use more types of new flowers, a new form of terrain (like mud from the mangrove forests), and some new animals. Maybe add some structures like a village or something that will make the players want to go there for something other than wood. Maybe a special type of dig site only found in this biome with items related to the story of the ancient cities? Maybe an item that opens the portal in the city, or something that gives use to the Mysterious Frame.
I think most of the sheeps spawning in this biome should be pink.
Hostile mobs should be uncommon or changed in this biome to fit a more loving biome to live in

Perhaps also Cherry Blossoms Tree of the colors; darker pink (common), pastel white (uncommon), pastel yellow (rare), and pastel lime (rare). All Cherry Blossom Logs should have the a very similar color bark until stripped or made into the various “plank” wood types, of course.
I really like the biome and the textures of the logs, but the leaves texture feels a little to hard and solid.

I do not know which type of cherry tree this tree was modeled after, but Yoshino cherries, which are widely planted in Japan, have much paler flowers and brownish-red leaves during the blooming season.
Also, the petals can be seen falling, but in the Yoshino cherry near the end of its bloom, the center of the flower is a darker pink color.

I suggest that in the cherry forest you can pick cherries from trees or bushes, this would be logical.

As for wood, I can’t say anything against it, but the color of the boards themselves is too colorful, I suggest making the texture shade darker or, for example, adding a little blueness there.

Hello, I think the grass colour should be different in the Cherry Grove biome. Perhaps a lighter, vibrant green (lighter than the jungle grass) - right now it seems it is very close to being similar to the plains biome, and I think it deserves something more special.

A “chance” of uncommon floating “orb fairies” should occasionally appear at night, perhaps on occasional phases of the moon at night & dissipate in the early morning, light fog in the Cherry Blossom Biome. 
players shouldn’t be able to directly interact with them. They should be semi transparent, and be able to move freely through most “overworld dimension blocks”; with the exception of iron blocks, glass blocks, fire, lava, slime blocks, skulk blocks, end dimension exclusive blocks, & neither dimension exclusive blocks. Perhaps, direct contact with fire & lava will force them to dissipate.
Players should be able to craft & bait a new block the “glass bottle” to have a chance of catching them. The “Bottled Fairy” Block should emit a low light.

Orb fairies should be pink (common), white (common), light yellow (uncommon), lime (uncommon), blue (rare), and a shade of light purple (rare).

this would be a great way to replace the idea of bottled fireflies.

The new biome feels awesome! But a bit incomplete, it doesn't fully immerse you. I really think you should consider adding some sort of new dirt block according to the new pink theme, maybe a light pinkish or a much pale green, something to add to the atmosphere.
the woodset looks great! You guys should add cherries along with the new trees though!

It's very cute! But it feels a little empty. So here's a few ideas to make the biome feel fully realized:

- I think the grass color should be changed to fit the color palette better

- The texture for the falling leaves could be more leaf-like

- Some more plants and flora, including taller ones. It would make it feel more "foresty" and even more unique than it already is

- And the cherry leaves could be tweaked to be just a bit more opaque

Overall I'm really happy about the biome!
Hello Mojang, for me the cherry tree is ugly from 1.20 compared to the cherry tree from the mod " oh the biome you'll go "

Have an uncommon “chance” of finding a hot spring or two in the Cherry Blossom Biome. The light steam around the hot spring(s) should provide an welcomed, occasional difference of atmosphere when found.

Also, consider creating the opposite in addition; A Hot Spring biome that has both more Hot Springs, but also generate with far less bunches of the beautiful Cherry Blossom Trees than the actual Cherry Blossom Tree Biome. Cherry Blossom Trees are somewhat common in such locations, and would look better spread out more if implemented as such. Although both Biomes sound about same, “on paper”, the actual implementation in-game both can & should be different to bring even more diversity to the locations that these beautiful trees can found.
I think the 1.20 update's background panorama should be a cherry blossom grove.

I like the concept and the design of the wood. I feel that there should be more transparency on the leaves so that they aren't as overpowering to look at. That would make them more beautiful and elegant.

I love the new cherry blossom leaves, but the spots of green in them feel somewhat out of place to me. I don't know how others feel about this, but I think the leaves would be better off with just the pink.
I think it'd be fun if cherries dropped from the leaves like apples do from other trees!
I think foxes should be able to spawn here. A lot of places where Cherry Blossoms are native, so are foxes. Plus they both share cultural significance in countries, like Japan.
The trapdoor texture needs a hard border around the entire texture, like every other trapdoor has

This is really cool, I love how it pops out in the distance when exploring and also seeing the blossom particles, they make the area feel alive.

To add a bit of variation it would be cool if there were some really tall leafless/ deadtrees that help to make the area more interesting.

Another thing that could be fun is if pink sheel were more common in this biome, it would be like adding a new mob without adding a new mob to the biome.

A small nitpick I had was that it's a cherry blossom biome without cherries. They could be added so that they grow like propagules and you can eat them or you could plant them in farmland and they could grow into saplings.

Cherries should fall out of the cherry leaf blocks.
I remind you that in the game we have apples falling from oak trees. Also, we're talking about trees that bloom forever and never fade (in-game), so they might as well drop cherry fruit.

I would like to see more foliage and diversity of flowers (tall, short) and the floor should be another color or something. Make a biome variant of this that has lakes and its more of a plains than mountain biome and maybe even bamboo.

new mobs for the biome. moobloom! butteflies! red panda? birds? also this is such a good opportunity to add tons of new flowers and natuery things. pls make the biome more special! maybe a custom structure like a giant sakuara tree with special loot!
add a new mob exclusive to the cherry blossom biome, such as red panda, deer, moose, birdie, moolip.
From time to time, a fallen cherry tree should appear in the biome, covered with moss and surrounded by moss, mushrooms and flowers.
The jumbo rabbit should spawn in this biome and drop up to two rabbit hides.

Given this biome general colour, it could be great if sheeps colour probability was changed in it; Currently With adults sheeps spawn, we have white (78% spawn colour chance), black/gray/light gray (5% each), brown (3%) and pink (0.008%).

To match with the biome's theme and general colour, i'd put the spawn chance of the black, gray, light gray, and brown to 0, and up the spawn chance for pink sheep. And to get a little more colour variety, maybe red and magenta sheeps could have some chance spawning too ? Just giving example percentages of course, but i'd have the white sheep be around 65%, then pink 25%, and red and magenta could both get 5%.

If you want to create some contrast, instead of red, magenta, and upped pink, maybe you could do the same but with the 3 blue sheeps, or others colours, unsure how it'd look at this point.

Hi ! This new biome Look Amazing (so beautiful). I was wondering : you should add new particles (with the particles of the falling leaves of the tree) that look like the blossom on the wind, it could be more realistic, like there were wind on the biome and the blossom fly away
Bamboo, peony, lilum, lily of the valley, allium, white and pink tulip should also appear in the biome.
It would be cool to have some kind of vines which are unique to the biome
Can you make a Japanese-inspired village type that spawns in these biomes or at least a villager type with Japanese-inspired clothing like in the jungle biome or swamp biome?

I played the new snapshot and I have a few problems that i found:

1st: The biome is too small to be a rare biome (https://prnt.sc/GOAk6zyChJIj), I guess it's enough for a old player that it's just trying to find a cherry sapling, but it's not enough space to build a house in that biome for example.

2nd: The leaves are a little overwhelming by looking at it, idk maybe consider changing the model a bit? I think it's because of the green spots that I maybe think it's strange, overall, the trees are pretty good, but i think there should be kind of a reward finding these? Maybe a cherry! I saw a comment on twitter that maybe a Cherry Pie should be added to minecraft with the *placeable* effect, and since we got a lot of decorations in this update, i think cherry pie should be one of them (enough of the cakes decoration)

The pink petals are really nice, I got caught by surprise when i added more petals to just one block, really good! My idea it's that some height would be great! 

Another thought about the biome: consider adding pink tulips and lilacs and peonys to the biome! 

(edit): the pink planks are a bit overwhelming too, maybe add some darker pink spots to them!

I thinks that's it, thank you for reading!

Love almost everything about this biome, amazing addition clearly. I do have one suggestion though, since the biome feels especially unique and special among forests, why not have the grass color be a lil more of a lighter, softer green much like how the other special forests have differing grass colors(I.E. Spruce, Jungle, and dark oak forests)? I think that would be really neat.

The biome is looking fantastic!

I do think that there could be some more transparency in the leaf textures. Currently, they seem very solid compared to other leaf types. It would also be amazing if there was some type of hanging cherry blossom vine that grew from the trees, which would give builders another fantastic block to adorn their builds with, as well as making the biome feel even more alive. I love the particles that fall from the trees. Currently however, they feel like dripping honey, and they splatter on the ground. Maybe the movement of the particles could be changed, to feel like the particles are tree leaves/blossoms that are gently blowing in the wind.

i have a super simple but scenic suggestion.

what if cherry blossom petals can float on water like the lily pads do.

i hope someone sees this and considers it as it would be a small but nice addition.
it would be nice that as apples fall from oak trees, cherries fall from cherry trees. Please add this fruit!

It looks great so far! I do think that maybe the trapdoor could use a little bit of a change to match the door pattern better. Everything else is just lovely and I can't wait for it to be on Bedrock preview to check it out myself

I love the way this biome looks. Though maybe lacking something like a unique mob for the biome, for instance maybe a red panda or a koi fish, those would probably take a lot of time to implement.

My only real problem with it is how the leaves and planks look, something about them feels off. To me, at least, the texture of the leaves is way too opaque, and the planks are very washed out.

Despite that, I think the biome as a whole still looks good. On another note about red pandas, if they were ever to be implemented, it would be funny and cute to see them stand up on their hind legs and raise their front paws like they do in real life. Sometimes they do this towards eachother, and it's meant to intimidate whoever it is doing this towards, but in reality it just looks silly and adorable.

I love the new biome, but I feel like the texture could use a lot of work on the logs and leaves! But great job!!! Maybe add a carpet sized blocks that are pettles on the ground??? It would be nice if the leave particles didn't just go straight down, maybe if they fell side to side it would look much nicer!

I think the Cherry Blossom particles that fall from the trees should look like more of a petal shape rather than a square! Currently I think it looks too much like Spore Blossom particles when the visuals could be much more unique.

Also I like the grass color, but it's perhaps a bit too subtle. Maybe make it more vivid?
I've also seen the idea of adding bamboo and boulders to these biomes, which I agree with heavily.

And finally, I think the most important thing is that the biomes generate too small. They should be way bigger, so it feels like a whole forest instead of a small patch!

Also what about cherries than can fall from broken cherry leaves, like apples? I think it'd be cute even if they're useless.

Beyond what other folks have said about adding other underbrush/foliage, I'd love to see the grass tint mapped to the grass.png colormap, rather than hardcoded. As it is, being unable to adjust the coloration makes it stand out really starkly when used with certain resource packs. Otherwise, loving it!

First of all I can’t believe this is coming to the main game! 10 years ago I remember seeing this biome and thought it was really cool. Anyways..

-the new plants look awesome

- the new wood type is the biggest and best thing about this new biome. It’s looks awesome and blends in really well

- pink sheep should spawn more frequently.

-like the jungle when it was first added it was very “oh nice… anyways” and I think that might happen to this biome. You go to get the wood and flowers and never go there again. Now the jungle is awesome with bamboo and pandas and parrots. So adding another mob might help it. Developing a new mob takes time so I don’t expect that this update.

- have the grass be more unique, maybe like more autumn or maybe more vibrant. Something that will have people want to have their home.

- what a great biome and hope it gets more and more love as the years go on

I think the planks should have a yellowish tint to the pink so it´s not the "pink wool 2.0" and a bit more interesting.

The colour of the grass could be even lime !?

If there were birds in this biome as a special, unique mob, it would add a lot to the beauty of this biome. Pink petals look nice, but it can quickly become repetitive to me, so flowers like dahlias or hibiscus can add to the mood, and the pink leaves are too vibrant, a less flowery type might be good.
I love the looks so far! But I have one major complaint, the texture of the leaves, I personally think: no green, more transparent, more variety/variation.

Add flower accumulation below naturally generated Cherry Blossom Trees. It can be similar to snow accumulation, but it only happens under theses leaves. Make the biome less sparse, so the floor could be as pink as possible. Also make it bigger, then you got a perfect biome.

1. Maybe is it a good idea that inside the Cherry Blossom Biome can spawn a small lake/pond with maybe Axolotl or another mob and on the lake/pond can spawn lily pads and water lilies. The rare lake/pond can be surrounded by a lot of cherry trees.

2. And now is the Cherry Blossom Biome not so interesting but have a nice new wood type, but it has only a new wood type/tree type with a new interesting flower type. Maybe inside the biome can spawn the Moobloom from 2020 in the biome, so there is a unique mob in the biome. And maybe pink sheeps can spawn there with a higher spawn rate.

3. More variants inside the biome. It can be again a good idea that inside the biome spawn again a completely new flower type or an existing flower type, for an example Allium or Lilac.

I love the new Cherry Blossom Biome! The atmosphere created by the particles floating around is really cool, and the pink petals also really add to the biome. I think, since sheep are one of the mobs spawning in the biome, all sheep that spawn there should be pink, as if their wool became colored from all the petals and particles in the biome. I really think this would add to the biome’s atmosphere, and it could also make the random pink sheep that spawn seem less weird.

I like the new biome, it's been fun to play with all the new wood as we have never had this color before in wood, which is amazing. But I'm not that much of a fan of how the leave particles look, it would make more sense to have them a leaf shape, like in the mods

Hey, I love the new biome! The pink petals are a really nice touch, but I do feel like it's still a bit empty. I think it would really benefit from ocassional ponds and/or bamboo, maybe not as dense as a jungle but still enough to make it pop. Different colored grass would look good too, like a more blue-ish/teal one to contrast the pink!
I know people keep asking for new mobs/features to improve it, but I do feel like the game already has more than enough to help

The biome, tree's and flowers look absolutely lovely! It's been something I've wanted to see in the game for years so I'm super happy this was added. My only point of feedback would be about the particles that come from the cherry blossom leaves. I love them for ambience but I feel like they fall too fast. I would suggest slowing their speed down and having them wave/sway around a bit to emulate wind movements - rather than the straight downward trajectory the particles currently have.
The moolips (moobloom pink) this cow would have the same utilities as the moobloom of minecon 2020

Well in my opinion I really liked the cherry blossom biome but when testing both in bedrock and in Java I didn't see a very big biome I didn't have the cherry blossom trees another thing I wanted a pink cow like mooblom Regarding the texture of the leaf, the number of leaves is very heavy in this regard, congratulations mojang.

I would love to see bushes to populate the ground a little bit more, as that's what feels particularly empty right now. This could also massively improve other biomes.
In my mind it would be just three to eight blocks or so, at a maximum of 2 blocks high and an area of a maximum of 3x2 the bigger ones could also have a log in between the leaves.

Letting pink and white flowers generate there is also a great idea.

The general gist is that the ground feels a bit empty in some biomes, including the cherry blossom forest.

Thanks for your consideration!

Love that this biome is coming to minecraft. I would like to see som sort of new flower, animals, vines, lightsource or stone that is assosiated with cherry trees and the biome you are creating. Makes it even more lovely to explore.
Foxes should spawn here, maybe a unique color. The leaves themselves are too thick as well, yhey need to be more transparent like other leaves
It would be great if the leaves drop apples or cherries.

The new Biome is awesome!
But please add Cherrys that drop from the leaves.
And it should have a unique mob like:
a Red Panda
a squirrel
or a hedgehog

this would make the biome so nice and unique.

Olá! Eu amei a floresta de cerejeiras! tão fofo e rosa! bem, se temos uma cerejeira porque não cerejas! diferente das maçãs que são colhidas quando as folhas das árvores são cortadas, a nova cereja é colhida pressionando levemente as folhas! Assim não será necessário cortar as flores dessa linda árvore! Obrigado por este trabalho incrível que vocês estão fazendo ^^ 🍒🌸

This biome is really great but my main idea for this new biome is cherries! You should be able to mine cherries from the tree leaves. They would be a fruit similar to apples, and you could even craft golden cherries if you want, but I'm not so sure what they would do. If anyone has any suggestions, leave a comment!

I want to suggest that the grass for this biome should resonate with the biome. The plain green grass doesn’t make the biome pop and is rather generic. Otherwise the Cherry blossom biome is very fitting and nicely designed.
Moobloms should spawn in the biome and the vegetation should be denser to make it stand out more, bamboo would be good

Cherry blossom biome is fantastic, I will just talk about small details.

1- Pink petals on the floor are great but it can only be placed on grass, dirt and dirt types. Please make it placeable on solid blocks/flat surfaces for decoration purposes. (other features such as adding flowers mechanic, bonemealing, being rotational all great) 

2- I found the leaves too thick and blocky, they could be a little bit more transparent. I think the problem is that flowers on leaf texture are so big

3- Please make cherry blossom particles more like spore blossom. Also right know when particles fall to ground they look like honey particles (horizontal lines on the floor) you can change particle type to look like spore blossom but make it spread to a smaller area
I think that this biome looks great but the one thing i would change is i would put bushes like in the jungle biome on the floor to help this biome feel more filled

HI Mojang,I think that for the cherry blossom biome you should add cherries,as apples for normal trees would be amazing if we could to find some cherries digging among cherry blossom's leaves.I hooe that my feedback could to help the team,we all want cherries in Minecraft and there isn't better occasion to add it.
I think the grass color should be something unique or more blue like the meadow biome around it. The current color feels bland.

Let me first say that I am incredibly happy about the addition of cherry blossoms, as they've been something I've wanted in the game for years. I think the log and plank color for the trees are perfect, but I have to say I don't think the leaves look quite right. Personally, I think that having both the pink and green included in the texture muddies the look, and I think that the texture would be improved by focusing on just the pink/white aspect of the flowers. Also, from what I've seen so far the biome generation in the snapshot is typically very small and only in mountains. I think for the sake of building bases larger, flatter cherry blossom forests would be a welcome addition.
Perhaps a shade of lime, Easter/spring green for the grass.
Add some mob like for example grizzly bear or deer in this biome , it lacks life , it feels a very common biome as a re textured needs something unique to motivate exploration.
Falling leaves particle should fly around for a few seconds instead of falling straight to the ground. Maybe adding this particle to other trees too.

Hello ! I think the color of the grass in the cherry blossom biome is a little weird... maybe a more yellow or a pink/purple color would be better.
Also, can you add cherry too ? It would be like apple but also like apple, it would have some golden cherrys which are usefull for potion recipe. Maybe Haste, darkness or a new effect for it.
Add Koi and make them spawn in ponds of this biome exclusively. Like what we can currently do with tropical fish, but with kois.

I made a suggestion about this separately but I would like to add this to the thread so it's easy to collate.

> Allow bamboo and birch trees to spawn in Cherry groves, to vary the tree cover like in normal Forests and add a splash of greenery. Possibly also add lily pads to water sources near Cherry biomes?


> Adjust the textures for the woodset. The stripped log is a gorgeous colour, and it would be nice if the planks, door and trapdoor matched that richer, slightly more saturated pink hue. Greetings Mojang Development Team, I have some small ideas that I think could really help pull cherry blossoms together! My main concern currently with the cherry blossom leaves, and cherry blossom petals, is that they generate a very grid-like pattern due to the textures being the same on all sides, which makes them feel more plastic-like when viewing, removing the feeling of fluffy trees. On the other hand, the petals that are placed on the tops of blocks are the same way, where they create a relapsing pattern that removes the natural wonder from the block. With that being said, I think there could be some simple changes that could be made to fix this! If like other flowers, the petals were somewhat randomized in orientation and also randomized in their position on a block, it would create a much more organic feel. When it comes to the cherry blossom leaves, if there was simply a slightly different texture on each side, and the leaves had a random orientation upon being generated/placed, it would make the cherry trees feel significantly more realistic! 
I hope this makes sense, and thank you for all that you do!

Hey, team! Here’s some things I’ve thought of and seen discussed online that could be used to alter the Cherry Grove!

• A lighter/unique grass shade variant that accentuates trees.
• A pink/lighter water tint too? Petals should be able to be placed on water too as if they are floating!
• More foliage and flowers, to create more variation? Possibly bamboo?

• Unique mob, like the Moobloom?

• White variant of cherry trees, would add more variation to biome and give players a white leaf block! Great for snowy builds.

• Mossy cobble cave feature with water running through?

I dont know how you guys manage to transform a old and incredible concept as cherry blossom biome in such a... lackluster experience.

  • Has been years since players make content around pink leaves. Resource packs, mods. 
  • Mods that has biomes with pink leaves, essentially makes the place an incredieble visual experience.
  • However, even the mods did not created an practical experience. Leaving the concept to be only asthetical.

With this in mind, is surprising that mojang manage to make the concept plain and boring.

  • There's nothing special about the biome. It's only a block and items repository. You go there, collect some of each item, then go. Nothing much to see, nothing much to do, nothing to explore. Could be fixed by giving us something special and unique to do here. Something that can only be done here. 
  • The biome lacks variety. All the petals on the ground makes for a beautiful and different place, but, is also repetitive. Could be fixed by adding a new vegetation that appear less, some brown tall grass or something.

But there are good things:

  • Mojang's version of pink leaves are the absolute best. Aesthetically, the individual components and trees rule over any other version that has been done before.
  • The wood set is perfect.

 

Extra: Why lush caves worked, and cherry blossom groove didnt?

  • Because lush caves functions like a corridor. You explore them, feel the incredieble atmosphere, and go. They ARE the cave. You MUST pass through. This is their function. Doest apply to cherry biome.

Another problem: For a biome that offer almost nothing new(apart from the pink wood), you need to put effort to reach it.

Compare the biome with mangroove swamp: You find one, take what you need, feel the atmosphere and go. But the cherry blossom groove, you doest just GO there. You have to climb. Is and actual effort. And effort with a basic reward.

Another comparison is the mountain biomes. You go there not to gather blocks and items, but because the geography itself. The geography IS the biome.

To fix this, we need to create a good and unique reward, that fits the biome.

It can be an experience, but should be something practical too. Maybe:

  •  The particles gives you and unique effect, and you can use itens find in excavation sites in the cherry groove to create an beacon-like block that gives you that effect.
  • Unique enchantments that can only be found there(In the enchanting table)
  • Unique new mob
  • Unique new ground

First, I'm really happy to see the long-awaited cherry blossoms in Minecraft! Thank you so much!

However, in 23w07a I feel it is strange that they have leaves and blossoms at the same time. Japanese cherry blossoms, especially the most popular one for appreciation (Prunus × yedoensis 'Somei-yoshino'), bloom in early spring before they make leaves. It is one of the reasons why they are beautiful, and I feel the texture is wrong in that they have green while they are in bloom.

I hope the green of the "cherry leaves" texture will be erased. Also, you might as well change its name to "cherry blossom block" if possible.

A new biome!!! So exciting! The Cherry Blossom Biome is beautiful to look at, and I'm very happy it's finally here. To disagree with other commenters, I believe the leaves and wood is lovely as it is, and adding multiple variants of it may become clunky and mottled, as no other trees have differing variety in their look except for shape. I believe the grass color is very pretty and has a nice soft yellow tint, very lush looking! I do like the thought of the terrain having some nice small hills or peaking ledges/overhangs, or spawn nicely on the steeper uphills of mountains alongside the upper plains, but I understand that may be hard to code!

The wood coloring is gorgeous, both the delicate pink planks and pretty purple hue of the bark, and they match so lovely with snow! Although, perhaps the Door/Trapdoor could have a more noticeable outline? They blend it very easily, especially the trapdoor, as beautiful as it is.

I will say the biome does feel a touch empty, however the particles and new flowers fill it in well! I like the thought of more sheep spawns, or maybe even more white rabbits alongside those lovely bees! Cherries and New Mooblooms are a wistful fantasy, but Lilacs and Peony fit nicely, so maybe they could spawn around trees? Overall I just can't wait to see my cute Sniffer friends frolicking in this lovely biome!!

I think a small but neat feature that could be added to the cherry blossom biome is the addition of marimo moss. In real life, marimo are small spherical mosses that grow at the bottom of ponds and slow moving rivers, near where cherry blossoms also grow. In game, they should function like sea pickles, being able to put up to four of them inside of a single block area. Bone mealing them should allow you to get an extra piece of moss, sort of like how bone mealing two block high flowers function. I think it would also appeal to the developer team's idea of "bringing awareness to endangered species". Just like the axolotl, their populations are declining in the wild due to pollution, yet are common aquarium pets.

Hello, I have a little opinion on the textures of the cherry blossom's leaves.
there's something quite peculiar that makes the cherry blossom trees and biome look too dark, like when you make a custom tree out of wool, and it's the pixel density on the texture, compared to other trees the cherry blossom has a pixel density close if not higher than the jungle tree which is known for almost solid leaves, IRL cherry blossoms have just a few leaves and flowers, not any higher than your "average" oak tree which is part of what makes them so beautiful and makes the flowers a little more special.
I don't think the green pixels are bad but overall there's too much pixel density between banging pink and green and very few holes to give transparency to the leaves.
If you have seen a cherry blossom in real life during the flowering season they are not that dense, you can see through them pretty easily but with the current texture it's pretty hard to see even through a single block.
I think a more classic style would fit better as the flowers are also not that big, 1 or 2 pixels is enough for a single flower and a pixel density similar or lower than the acacia tree would do the trick.
I hope at least something is done about the density because right now they look almost as solid as a tree of pink wool and this tree is suposed to be an alternative to fix what "felt" wrong about wool trees.

I live in Japan and there are many cherry trees near my house. In spring, the ground at the school gate is filled with cherry petals.
Now, the cherry blossoms in the snapshot are really wonderful, and I think their beauty is no less than the actual cherry blossoms. Well, here are some ideas to make it more attractive.
> Cherry blossom petals (particles) are often blown by the wind and fall at an angle instead of vertically. Also, air resistance causes them to flutter and fall, swaying from side to side like feathers. How wonderful it would be if particles in games could move like this.
> How beautiful it would be if the particles naturally piled up pink petals on the blocks below.
> I guess it depends on the type, but Japanese cherry blossoms are a bit paler and whiter. The texture of the cherry blossom leaves could be a bit lighter in color or contain a bit more white.

A lot of people are complaining about the leaves.

The problem is the pink flowers are not obvious on the leaf texture.

Cherry blossoms only have flowers when they blossom! Currently, the texture has three flowers on each side and a pink and green background (why?), so remove the pink and green background.

Additionally, the flowers are too big at 7 pixels wide. Make them a similar size to azalea flowers at three pixels wide (a maroon dot for a stigma in in the middle, with 4 light pink pixels around it as petals). So smaller, but more abundant flowers. This would also solve the issue that the leaves look tiled, since the big flowers make the patter look obvious.

Tldr, smaller, but more flowers on leaf texture. make the flowers popout more by removing the pink and green leaves.

I've really enjoyed the new Minecraft biome when testing out the new snapshot, but there are some things I would like changed:

1. The trees
The leaves are too square, unlike the "Japanese cherry blossom trees", that arch and have lots of branches. A good example of trees whos leaves aren't square are azalea trees, that just look amazing. They'd also look much better if the trees were closer together, leaving little room for sunlight to pass and had branches going diagonally up instead of horizonally then up. They'd also look good if they had roots just like the Mangrove trees, but smaller.

2. The texture on the cherry blossom leaves
The flowers on the leaf look great, but I personally dislike the green leaves mixed in with the pink, as cherry blossoms do not have green leaves, only pink ones.

3. The textures on cherry wood planks and its doors/trapdoors
The textures are too bright, with very little contrast, unlike crimson or oak planks. Plus the colour pallet on the trapdoor and door do not match the planks. I do like the stripped wood and the trapdoor and door design.

4. Adding lakes / ponds / waterfalls

The biome looks kind of bland, it'd look a lot better with more variety and features, such as ponds with frogs and fish.

Questions:
Will it be able to snow in cherry blossom biomes?
Will hostile mobs spawn in cherry blossom biomes? It'd be nicer if there were no hostile mobs in the biome, since it feels like more of a comforting biome to stay in, that gives off a relaxing vibe.

Hello Minecraft team! I believe that something new needs to be added alongside this biome to make it stand out more from regular forests. Right now it’s just kind of a pink version of all the woodsy areas we already have, so I think there should be something to tell it apart.

You could maybe add more foliage, like a couple people suggested, or a new mob that spawns only in this biome. Different tree variants, different grass, maybe floating pink petals could occasionally go across your screen like snow or rain does?

I know realistically not all of these things can be added (though I wish they could), but I think choosing one or two could really help set this biome apart!

Thanks for reading!

A lot of people want every biome to have specific uses and mobs so that players will have an interest in finding said biome.
But i don't think it should always be the case, sometimes, juste exploring and discovering something new should be enough.
Some players will go to places that give them the most interesting resources, like diamonds or netherite, and then they will directly fight bosses or explore structures. They don't really see the interest in a biome that doesn't offer them with some kind of overpowered item or hostile mobs to fight.
Some other people will love taking their time to explore a biome, to build a hut in the middle of said biome and to just profit of the moment.
Minecraft has both those types of things, and i personnally think the cherry blossom biome is one of the latest.
This biome is just wonderful and stunning, and i really feel like i could stay in here during the entirety of the day. In my humble opinion, if changes were to be made to this place, it should be changes mainly about the atmosphere.
Exemples : This biome is located on mountains, so maybe a wind sound effect could be added, because the sound of wind is chilling/relaxing and it makes you feel a sense of excitation and adventure.

2 : If there was a cave entrance located in the biome, maybe cherry roots would block it to prevent  players to endanger themselves.

3 : a new chilling music that you would only hear here.

4 : a material to craft incense, that would emit a purple smoke for decoration.

While the new forest looks amazing, it lacks character. I feel like what it needs is more foliage, as others have addressed, and I'm thinking that maybe we need another new food source plant. A good choice would be strawberries! They fit the pink cherry blossom color scheme and they have some real potential. Imagine being able to craft strawberry jam or strawberry pie in Minecraft. We already have one bush crop, but that only spawns in the Taiga, and again, the cherry blossom biome is... bland so far, to say the least. Plus, strawberries feel more thought-out than putting cherries in the mix, don't you think? Cherry blossoms and cherries? Where's the creativity?! Cherry blossom trees were actually bred for their flowers, not their fruit, so their 'cherries' are small and sour and gross. Also, according to a quick google search, strawberries may fit with cherry blossoms more than I thought! Did you know that one of Japan's four variants of strawberries, the "Amaou strawberry," is called the King of Strawberries? They are usually large, round, and sweet. But I'm getting off topic; with the new Minecraft update in the works, I'm really hoping to see a well-polished biome as per usual. I just couldn't help myself in sharing me and my friends' suggestion.

POR FAVOR, não adicionem em pleno 2023 um novo bioma sem vida ao Minecraft. Os desenvolvedores sabem muito bem que os jogadores pedem mais diversidades nos biomas do jogo, e isso não se trata de colocar de maneira exagerada mobs e estruturas neles. Mas sim de trabalhar sua fauna e flora, tornando cada bioma único. E não apenas um local com uma nova árvore com suas madeiras de cor diferente.

Por isso segue abaixo algumas sugestões para que esse novo bioma que será adicionado, seja não só lindo, mas também incrível:

- Moolip (uma variação da Moobloom, que só será gerado nesse novo bioma)

- Carpa colorida (um peixe muito comum do Japão, que só será gerado em pequenos lagos ou riachos que vão existir nesse novo bioma).

- Arbusto de pétalas rosas (apenas as pétalas rosas que estão no chão não bastam, por favor não façam apenas o mínimo. Não se trata de encher de maneira exagerada o bioma com flores, um novo arbusto já seria suficiente para complementar o bioma)

Number one on my wishlist for this beautiful biome: I fervently pray that the Moolip makes her debut here. I know it might be a bit late in the development cycle to add the "unique interaction with bees", but I love the Moolip so much it actually drove me to start playing with mods for the first time. These days I mainly play Bedrock though, so it's become really important to me that my favourite mob might finally be accessible in vanilla. 

Second on my wishlist: ponds/hot springs. I love the suggestions for koi, marimo balls and petals that float on water. How can we appreciate the colour of the water if water doesn't generate?

I also approve of foxes, as there aren't many places in the game at the moment where they can spawn without risking being chased and killed by wolves. Moss or mossy boulders would also be a beautiful complement, as would lilacs/wisteria.

2 wool, 3 logs, 3 sticks, 1 coal

no spawn point

This is absolutely a necessary feature because the current spawn mechanics in the game hinder exploration. You can't go exploring far from your base because if you do, you'll be exploring at night, and if you skip the night with a bed, you lose your spawn point. Then if you die you have to go all the way back to your base, which could be far from spawn. In this way, Minecraft ties the player to spawn, making it impractical to make use of the insanely large Minecraft map.

This problem was extremely apparent in PiroPito's playthrough on YouTube. He wanted to make a 1 million block long bridge, but he didn't understand spawn mechanics fully, and he often found himself getting teleported back to spawn, where the beginning of his bridge was. He then had to spend hours travelling tens of thousands of blocks to get back to where he left off. He doesn't upload much anymore.

Hi Mojang! I am a graduate student studying archaeology, and I wanted to say that you have made my year by announcing this! Everyone in my department that I've told has been equally excited, and we are all looking forward to seeing how y'all will expand it.

There is only one piece of feedback that I have right now, and that is that archaeologists technically refer to pottery shards as "pottery sherds." I've included the Wikipedia article about them here if y'all want to check it out: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sherd. It's not a huge thing, but if you changed them from "shards" to "sherds" in-game then it would make a ton of archaeologists very happy!

Let's start in order:

Brush: copper is visible on the texture of the brush, but for some reason copper itself is not used in crafting, which is very strange, this should be fixed. I also suggest the ability to add enchantments to the brush, or not enchantments but upgrades to the blacksmith's table.

Suspicious sand: is a very nice block and would like to mine with silk touch to use in buildings. Also, I may have been unlucky, but I did not find suspicious sand near the temples and desert wells.

Pots: I am delighted with pots, I want to offer a couple of mechanics for them. The first mechanic is that it will be possible to plant flowers that are 2 blocks high in a pot, this would be very beautiful. The second mechanic is the storage of water, honey, milk and other liquids or mixtures that can be drunk or eaten in the game. The third mechanic is to paint pots with 4 colors maximum, because pots are crafted from 4 bricks or shards.

Archeology: is an interesting mechanic that needs more ideas, such as archeology being possible in biomes other than desert, such as mesa, savannah, mangrove swamps, plains, jungles, and so on. Also, in addition to pots and sniffer eggs, it would be necessary to add other artifacts that would either help in survival or in construction, but I hope you can come up with this yourself.

Archaeology at this stage is too simple in mechanics. In the presentation of 2020, it was shown that with sloppy work, you can break a block with an object. I suggest introducing it here - now, you have to make sure that the item is EXACTLY coming out of the block. All this will depend on the side in which you dig it: conditionally, you can dig it on the right, but it can only get out if you dig on the left. Otherwise, you will simply destroy the item inside. Therefore, it is advisable to walk through the block on each side (except the bottom edge) to understand exactly where to dig.

It also seems to me that for a deserted temple, you need to make several secret rooms with suspicious sand, which will randomly replace each other from structure to structure. For example, in one temple we see a standard staircase to the right of the entrance, in the far corner of the room, but in the second temple this room will be located under one of the turrets. Thus, the player will carefully inspect the entire structure.

And finally, I believe that the mechanics of archaeology can also fit well into the following structures: 
1) Jungle temple --> Suspicious gravel ---> patterns of ocelot, bat, watermelon, sun; 
2) Underwater ruins --> Suspicious sand/gravel ---> patterns of fish, Guardian, waves, portal to Nether;  
4) The remains of Bastions ---> Swollen  Netherrack---> symbols of piglins, maliciously frowning eyes, a shiny block, a mushroom; a new kind of vases from Netherrack

Now I want to touch the vases because they have great potential:
1) Bring back the old way of making vases from the 2020 presentation: first you make a vase mold from six clay balls, then you put ceramic shards into this mold, and then fry on fire. This way of making you seems more exciting and time-consuming.


2) Make several shapes for you, in addition to the current one: a vase as from the 2020 presentation; a small vase similar to a clay pot; an elongated vase, as from the concepts of an Ancient city, etc.


3) Practical application for vases - with Hopper you can put up to a stack of various items (as with bundles), but no one can find out what is stored inside it. The only way to get the items is to break the vase.


4) Allow to make inserts of different colors in vases using various metals (iron, copper, diamonds) similar to what we currently have with armor.


5) Vases have physics, and can break if they fall from a height of more than 1 block.

Archeology looks like it's going to be an awesome mechanic within the game. Exploring the snapshot, I felt really excited when I discovered the new hidden room in the desert temple. It was awesome to feel like I was uncovering some ancient secret ruins and carefully brushing away the sand to reveal them. However, in it's current condition, an archeological dig can only happen in this same room, or the desert well - two places where a dig site is always guaranteed, and always the same - which will quickly become stale.

I know you are searching for feedback or ideas for new places archeology could be used. I think it would be fantastic if there were a variety of buried desert ruin types that could be found across the desert. Like in the original announcement trailer, this would encourage the player to venture across the desert (maybe on a camel!) keeping an eye out for suspicious sand, or maybe some ancient ruins poking out of the ground. Then, the player could set up a camp and begin slowly uncovering the ruins and unearthing all the treasures within. This could be similar to the way underwater ruins are - a variety of small to medium structures, but buried in the sandy layer of the desert. This would further encourage exploration and would make archeology a much more enriching experience.

In the future, archeology could be expanded to other biomes and ruins, like the jungle, mesa, or under the sea. I'm excited to see how this feature will turn out!

My biggest suggestions for improvement:

There should be more unique loot to archaeology (this is probably quite obvious, but it is still important).

Each structure where archaeological finds exist should have its own unique loot tables. This is so that players have a basis to come up with theories for the history of each structure.

The brush should have more use-cases other than only brushing sus sand. Maybe it could turn blocks into their polished versions, turn cracked blocks into their un-cracked versions, make it so it guarantees a drop when used on blocks like leaves, etc. This would make it more likely for new players to learn what its purpose is, and would in turn make them more likely to use it on sus sand.

In regards to the new pots: I love these blocks as a new customizable decoration. They have fantastic potential and could be made even better with just a few changes!

In the initial announcement for archeology, we were shown a player placing pottery shards onto a pot and then physically firing the pot. This method of creating pots would likely be more engaging and immersive to the player than just another crafting recipe. However, I do understand that there might reasons for changing this initial method to a crafting recipe.

Additionally, I hope there will be a larger variety of pottery shard types added. Currently there are just four, meaning if different players wanted to create a pot with 4 unique sides, they would always be the same. One of the goals for this update and the pots are self expression and storytelling, and I think having a wider selection of shards to choose from allows for better self expression, and more ways to tell stories written on the pots!

I think archeology has a lot of potential to engage with structures in new ways, but I don't feel like the current implementation adds much to the way players go about interacting with structures. Having suspicious sand only spawn in a very small, consistent, location within both desert temples and wells, ends up making engaging with archeology a quick and repetitive experience (which is already a common criticism with many overworld structures). This is especially true in desert temples, where it seems a specific room was added to exclusively house suspicious sand. In it's current form, archeology just doesn't feel like the player is excavating 

If suspicious sand was instead spawned in the area around these structures (instead of specific locations within them) it might create a gameplay experience that has more longevity and separates itself more from the mentality of looting. 

I personally love the idea of giving more depth to structures and ways to interact with them. Having a reason to excavate around or near a structure would be a neat little activity that might prompt players to set up a camp near or within the structure itself. I'm just worried in its current form, archeology will end up being a 2 minute box players feel a need to check whenever they find a structure.

In my gameplay i only found like, three suspicious sands, and in the desert pyramid i found none, but i noticed some sand patches in the pyramid, IF the sus sands are randomized, maybe consider increasing the rates of the sus sand? 

Also, the brush craft it's a bit common, i think using copper and feathers would add a bit more value to those items! 

Please consider adding more places that the suspicious sand spawn, deserts are a cool idea, but it makes them REALLY rare, and being able to enter creative mode and using locate and finding only three it's pretty boring. The excavation sounds and feature looks dope tho!
I think it would be cool to see different pot colours. You could craft the 4 pottery shards around a block of terracotta and the terracotta sets the pots base colour.

I think the placing system should be changed, more for like slapping them on, or have an uncooked one, but it on, cook it, boom. A Dev had the argument "we didnt want to do that bcuz how could a new player ever know that", however the entire archeology system counteracts that, you have to know where to go, what to look for, and how to do it. and the crafting recipe isn't obvious with that and I think just popping it on makes more sense. It would also make the gameplay of archeology just a bit more interesting.

There should be more places to find dig sites other than the desert. Underwater ruins would be a good place to find things, and perhaps most biomes could get their own small ruins similar to desert wells?

Overall I really like its implementation, and although I wish there were more incentives for other types of players than just builders to do some archeology. I like how the new pots look, but I personally am not very fond of the changes made to how they work. I'm fine with shards now being patterns for a full side of the block rather than a full story you can put on the pot, it is mainly another change I am not very fond of.

I think it is a shame the baking part of the pottery process seen in mc live when archeology was first announced is removed. It made it feel like real pottery. As a child I used to make things using a clay a lot, and seeing what I make be baked was one of the things that got me the most excited about it.

I get that new players would have no way of knowing how this system would work, but that goes for the entire archeology system, really, so I'm not seeing how the entire system would get a free pass on that but not pottery.

At the moment Archeology just isn't hitting right with me. I genuinely feel the system was oversimplified to the point where it isn't exciting or explorative.

Brush: I actually quite like the brush and the brushing mechanic, however the recipe should be a stick, a copper, and a feather.

Location: As of now, Archeology is exclusive to suspicious sand found at desert wells and desert temples, I would love to see suspicious dirt and add new archeological digsites/structures

can we please have underground structures just below the ground everywhere in the map regardless of the biome that has different variants of the suspicious block like dirt and gravel? The brushing mechanic is not as nice looking as it did in minecon, it looks a bit more low budget now. Please change it back.

In general, i think more suspicious sand could generate in desert pyramids and desert wells, as right now, its quite too rare.
the new room in the desert pyramid is great, but i think it could not be all covered with sand and suspicous sand, instead just have some piles of those blocks around, but still be open enough to find the room and have see a bit of how it looks. if more rooms were added in the structure, maybe using the space underground, it could encourage more time and exploration in the structure and possible places to find more suspicious sand
Suspicious sand could be in both older and new rooms of the desert pyramid as it would make it more diverse and longer to explore around.

The pots are a great addition, but they could be colored and be used to store things or aleast hold big flowers & plants. The pottery shards are pretty great and its a excellent choice how some can only be found in the pyramids and one in the wells, it makes the quest of finding them all be more varied, but more designs of pottery shards could be added, for decoration and diversity of finding them.

there no customization like we saw in the original showcase and there should be at least 50 pieces or a similar number of pieces that you can combine to make self expressed pots. The sand animation should look like the more natural one in the original showcase . Pots should come in different sizes/shapes which can be made from a new crafting block that “shapes” the pots. One of the main shapes should be a flask, bowl for suspicious stews, buckets, and just the normal small and big pot which can both hold flowers. This should also mean the bigger pot should be able to hold at least 2-5 flowers. small pots can have only one piece on each side while the more bigger pots like buckets and big pots can have 1-6 pieces on each side. adding colors to the pots gives the pots a more natural look that resemble clay colors.
